;

;How to establish prestige when you have just been promoted to a leader? One netizen said that this can be divided into three situations. First, the most ideal situation: your appointment is a typical internal promotion. Everyone thinks you are the best candidate to be the leader of the department, so it doesn’t matter whether you establish prestige or not. At this time, you only need to do what a leader should do and let everyone recognize your management methods and abilities. Second, a more difficult situation: because you have been transferred from another department, the employees in your department are still relatively unfamiliar with you. In this situation, you should not first think about how to establish prestige. Instead, you should act as a new member of the department and adopt the concept of learning to adapt to and learn from the situation of this department. Once you have figured it out, you can then think about the next step. matter.

;

;The most difficult situation is the third situation: your appointment has aroused opposition from many people in the department, and many people feel that you are not worthy of being the leader. At this time, if you don’t have strong abilities, it’s better not to think about the self-defeating tactics of Zhaoliwei. You should focus on maintaining the situation first, and then look for opportunities to find ways to break through the resistance that affects you.

;

;The above classification is still very reasonable, and my experience can also confirm it.

;

;Years ago, when I took the position of director of an important department at my former employer and became the leader of many old colleagues, I also thought about this issue.

;

;When I first came to this unit, I was still a trainee. Most of my colleagues who later became "subordinates" of my department are already senior employees. After I was promoted to a full-time position in advance and was promoted in advance, I felt tremendous pressure. I was afraid that my colleagues in the department would not listen to me, which would cause great embarrassment. As a person who has worked in the military camp for twelve years and "managed people", I understand that the environment I am in is different. I don't think I have the temperament of a "tyrannical CEO" at all, so I choose the most clumsy and dull kind. For example, I lead everyone to work together, occasionally share tasks for colleagues and then give them "work points", and I also create things in my spare time. On the condition that they are invited to eat and play, and they try their best to help colleagues in need. Strive to win favor with a "passionate leadership" attitude. This approach is very different from that of "smart people" who are good at playing tricks and talking around. I used to think that what I did was a sign of lack of "leadership", but now that I think about it, what I did was actually not bad.

;

;But I doubt whether a leader like me belongs to the "minority".

;

;Needless to say, there is an unknown dream of "tree power" hidden deep in our souls. Wang Xifeng in the Grand View Garden also wanted to establish his authority and used various tricks for this purpose. For many people, the hardest thing to resist is the urge to show off their status in front of others.

;

;As I get older, I can better understand the frivolousness of being eager to declare authority when I "reached the top" of the department when I was young. Over the years, I have seen several newly promoted young cadres being "verbally bribed" by frequently calling them "Director X" and "General Manager X", with visible pride on their faces. There are countless workplace dramas in which, in the eagerness to establish prestige and eliminate "thornheads", they get into a big fight with their subordinates and find it difficult to deal with the situation. The shortcomings are still due to the lack of knowledge in the heart, and they actually act willfully regardless of their actual situation.

;

;Considering the circumstances mentioned by the respondent, if everyone is convinced by you, is there any need to show your authority? If everyone is "not cold" towards you, is there any point in showing off your prestige?

;

;What's more, what some people call "establishing authority" is to use power to suppress others and use "authority" to the extreme. Otherwise, they will feel that their rights do not expire and become invalid. In the workplace, this disease is not as common as Other areas are lighter.

;

;A good friend of mine said it well, letting someone be a leader means letting you take the lead in doing things, not letting you deal with others. However, some people who hold leadership positions with dishonorable reputations or unworthy morals care about their "tails" being discovered and stepped on by their subordinates. Therefore, they either play the trick of killing chickens to scare monkeys, or they show off their power. In the attitude of "You have to be afraid of me" and "It's better to kneel down and lick me". This is not to establish authority, it is simply to establish enemies.

;

;Today, if some people insist on "controlling others" in the workplace, they will often hit a wall. Even if I can't survive your actions, isn't it okay to change departments and leave? How many people's resentment and disdain are hidden in the narrative here between the iron-clad "workplace" and the smooth "beating workers"?

;

;Of course, it is not a bad thing for a person to have prestige, or to want to establish prestige. However, it is open to speculation as to where a person's prestige should come from - whether it comes from power and the means designed to display power, or from character and ability.

;

;In fact, no matter what circumstances you become a leader, whether you are inside or outside the system, you cannot do without this question: Is your judgment better than that of your subordinates? , whether what you do is more beautiful than what your subordinates do. In the final analysis, as a leader, whether you have authority or not is determined by your professional ability and character. When you are well-equipped with both political integrity and talent, and do things well, even if you are an "airborne soldier" or a rising star, you will still be respected by your subordinates.

;

;Specifically, when faced with hesitation, it is inevitable to make decisions with leadership authority and let subordinates follow the arrangements. However, in a normal context, leaders must not only be good at forming consensus with subordinates, but also be good at forming consensus with subordinates. Have the awareness and courage to advance and retreat together, and must defend the legitimate rights and interests of subordinates at all times. As an old friend said, a leader cannot protect his subordinates from wind and rain. What do you want the leader to do? Is it just a decoration?

;

;More than ten years ago, when my "power" was at its greatest, the department consisted of three or four departments, with dozens of employees, and the management situation was quite complicated. I don’t know if I have built up any prestige during my years as a department leader, but after I left my job, I overheard praise from my old colleagues: I dared to take on tasks for my subordinates. In addition, some colleagues also said to me, "You have resigned, so why are we still here?" and they finally left after me. I am often inexplicably moved by these sincere words and true nature, and feel that I am worth it.

;

;In reality, it is not uncommon for leaders to have great ambitions but little talent, and for laymen to lead experts, and such leaders are particularly indifferent to the rights and feelings of their subordinates. They either give credit to themselves and pass the blame to their subordinates, squeeze and intimidate them in various ways, and simply treat their subordinates like fools, or they are alienated from their subordinates, suspicious of each other, and have no integrity. For this kind of leader, even if no one dares to say "no" to his face, he will inevitably be scolded behind his back. It should be noted that no one in this world is a fool.

;

;In short, a leader should look like a leader: have good judgment and strong ability to act, be able to make decisions, take responsibility, and have a simple and strong character. Even if such a leader's ability needs to be strengthened, he can still improve his overall performance and gain the understanding and support of his subordinates. Can a leader who is magnanimous and fair in his actions have a bad reputation? I have lived over fifty years and have never seen an example to the contrary.

;

;In the past few decades, Zhenjiang’s economy has mainly relied on heavy industries such as chemicals. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;“This year, the feeling is very obvious. Mainstream financial institutions have begun to do business in Zhenjiang.” A financial leasing company An employee told Southern Weekend reporters that due to risk control reasons, the company had not done business in Zhenjiang for several years, but this year it allowed it to do so.

;

;Since 2013, the scale of Zhenjiang’s debt has continued to rise, and it was even once called the “four major Internet celebrities” in the market’s urban investment debt issues, together with Zunyi, Xiangtan, and Dalian.

;

;According to Enterprise Early Warning Data, if the debt ratio is calculated as (government debt + urban investment platform interest-bearing debt)/GDP, Zhenjiang’s debt ratio has increased from 105% in 2018 to 121% in 2020 . In the past three years, its debt ratio has been higher than that of the other 12 prefecture-level cities in Jiangsu.

;

;The high debt ratio has increased financial pressure in Zhenjiang, and financial institutions have also been deterred, and most have chosen to reduce their business volume in Zhenjiang. However, in 2023, Zhenjiang’s local debt situation showed obvious signs of improvement.

;

;An obvious signal is that two urban investment companies in Zhenjiang have just received AAA entity ratings.

;

;On October 13, 2023, the official website of the Jiangsu Provincial State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission issued a document stating that Zhenjiang Industrial Investment Holding Group Co., Ltd. and Zhenjiang Urban Investment Holding Group Co., Ltd. have both obtained AAA subject credit ratings, realizing the credit construction of Zhenjiang City. A historic breakthrough.

;

;Previously, the highest credit rating of Zhenjiang’s urban investment companies was AA+. Among the 13 prefecture-level cities in Jiangsu Province, Lianyungang, Suqian and Zhenjiang have no urban investment companies with AAA credit ratings. Obtaining an AAA rating means that the financing difficulty of the urban investment platform is reduced and the cost is reduced.

;

;“After the debt situation eased this year, our bank reopened the credit line to a city investment platform in Zhenjiang.” A person who works at a city commercial bank in Jiangsu revealed to Southern Weekend reporters that the city investment company had previously Risk point: His bank had suspended credit to the company.

;

;In 2022, among the 13 prefecture-level cities in Jiangsu Province, Zhenjiang’s GDP ranked fourth from the bottom. Although it is located in southern Jiangsu, its economy is far away from Wuxi, Changzhou and Suzhou.

;

;How did Zhenjiang, a relatively weak economy, resolve hundreds of billions of debts?

;

;“There are more difficulties than expected, and the challenges are greater than expected”

;

;Zhenjiang is located at the intersection of the Yangtze River and the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal, guarding the north-south hub, and is connected with Nanjing, Changzhou, Taizhou and Yangzhou border on each other.

;

;According to the Jiangsu Statistical Yearbook and the seventh national census data, Zhenjiang covers the smallest area among the 13 prefecture-level cities. Among the population distribution across Jiangsu Province, only Zhenjiang has a permanent population of less than 4 million. In other words, Zhenjiang has the least land and the least people.

;

;In 1983, Zhenjiang became a provincial municipality. In the past few decades, Zhenjiang's economy has mainly relied on heavy industries such as chemicals. According to the Zhenjiang Municipal Economic and Social Development Bulletin, from 2013 to 2017, the total output value of Zhenjiang heavy industry accounted for more than 80% of the total output value of designated industries.

;

;At the end of 2016, in order to protect the ecological environment, Jiangsu Province began to deploy special actions to reduce backward chemical production capacity.

;

;According to the official website of the Zhenjiang Municipal Government, in 2017, the city shut down a total of 53 chemical companies, exceeding the provincial target (6 companies).

;

;“For backward and excess production capacity, we must resolutely eliminate those that should be eliminated.” In January 2019, Bu Xiaofang, then director of Zhenjiang Municipal Economic and Information Technology Commission, introduced that in 2018, the city shut down 44 chemical companies, a total of 44 chemical companies were shut down in the past two years. Nearly half of chemical companies have been shut down.

;

;Under environmental protection regulations, Zhenjiang’s economy has entered a period of pain.

;

;In 2018, its annual fixed asset investment fell by 26.5% compared with the previous year, and private investment fell by 30.4%. In terms of industries, investment in the secondary industry dropped by 28.9%, of which industrial investment dropped by 27.9%; investment in the tertiary industry dropped by 24.3%.

;

;Also this year, Zhenjiang’s GDP growth rate was 3%, ranking last among the 13 prefecture-level cities. Its GDP growth rate was 9.3% in 2016 and 7.24% in 2017.

;

;The 2019 Government Work Report introduced that in the past year, the three indicators of Zhenjiang’s GDP, total retail sales of consumer goods, and fixed asset investment have failed to meet the goals set by the People’s Congress.

;

;The then mayor of Zhenjiang City, Zhang Yefei, said in his government work report, "Looking back on 2018, there were more difficulties and greater challenges than expected."

;

;Many people in northern Jiangsu In cities, chemical industry is also an important industry, so why does it have less impact on economic growth than Zhenjiang?

;

;An economist in Zhenjiang told Southern Weekend reporters that unlike the northern Jiangsu region, the Yangtze River flows through Zhenjiang. In the past, many chemical companies were located in areas closer to the Yangtze River. In the past few years, the Yangtze River Under the Great Protection Strategy, environmental protection management has become more stringent, and many chemical companies have had to close down or move away.

;

;“The upgrading of industrial structure requires a buffer period.” The scholar analyzed that compared with other cities in southern Jiangsu, Zhenjiang’s high-tech enterprises and advanced manufacturing enterprises are small in scale and lack core leading enterprises, which will lead to local The capacity for economic development is limited.

;

;In 2017, after the new leadership team of the Municipal Party Committee and Municipal Government took office, Zhenjiang’s development philosophy also changed.

;

;“Zhenjiang will never repeat extensive growth in pursuit of speed, never engage in ‘numbers games’ in pursuit of political achievements, will never borrow blindly for image projects, and will never sacrifice the ecological environment in pursuit of economic interests. ." In January 2019, Zhang Yefei, then mayor of Zhenjiang City, said in an interview.

;

;While the chemical industry was shut down and reorganized, a large amount of debt burdened by the vigorous development of urban construction in previous years was still accumulating, which put pressure on Zhenjiang's finances of low revenue and high debt.

;

;In January 2017, the Zhenjiang Municipal Government’s work report stated, “In the past five years, the urban area has completed a total of 290 billion yuan in urban construction investment.” In comparison, Zhenjiang’s general public budget revenue in 2017 was 28.4 billion yuan. .

;

;During this period, urban investment debt also increased rapidly. According to the Enterprise Alert, from 2013 to 2017, the interest-bearing debt of Zhenjiang Urban Investment Platform increased from 122.1 billion yuan to 350.3 billion yuan, an increase of 187%.

;

;In 2018, the Jiangsu Provincial Party Committee inspection team inspected the Zhenjiang Municipal Party Committee and found that during a certain period, "the municipal Party committee did not do enough research on debt control, economic layout, major projects, and urban construction."

;

;The Zhenjiang Municipal Party Committee wrote in the inspection and rectification report that in view of the inadequate management of government investment projects, it was made clear that all government investment projects must be managed by the municipal party committee and municipal government through unified decision-making, and a series of documents were issued to build a System system for completion acceptance.

;

;"Municipal finance has completely returned to 'food finance'"

;

;Economic growth has slowed down, a large amount of money has been invested in urban construction, and there is rigid payment pressure on the finance. Zhenjiang's local debt problem has gradually exposed.

;

;In August 2018, Zhenjiang City’s budget implementation in the first half of the year revealed that the scale of municipal fiscal maintenance and operation expenditures has increased year by year. In 2018, the municipal department budget arrangements for personnel, operations and business project expenditures were close to 3.4 billion yuan. "Under the development trend of large total operating expenditure, high proportion, and rapid growth, municipal finance has completely returned to 'food finance'."

;

;"Food finance" refers to the fiscal revenue of the first-level government, which is only enough to maintain the salaries of personnel in government agencies and institutions, as well as basic daily operations. In 2018, Zhenjiang City’s general public budget revenue was 12.6 billion yuan. 3.4 billion yuan, equivalent to 27% of the general public budget revenue that year.

;

;Zhenjiang’s 2018 budget execution report stated that incremental financial resources are limited, and the balance of fiscal revenue and expenditure in recent years has mainly relied on revitalizing existing stocks, coordinating funds, and replacing financial resources. However, there is less and less room to absorb incremental expenditure through existing financial resources.

;

;China Discipline Inspection and Supervision News reported that on January 18, 2019, Lou Qinjian, then Secretary of the Jiangsu Provincial Party Committee, pointed out that “Zhenjiang City has weak links in supervision of key areas, and the government’s hidden debt risks are prominent. , and there are even corruption issues.”

;

;Slowly, Zhenjiang’s debt situation became known to the outside world.

;

;For Zhenjiang, debts are mainly concentrated in various urban investment platforms, and government debt is still controlled under the limit. If you look at the debt scale of Zhenjiang Urban Investment alone, it is much lower than that of Suzhou, Wuxi, Changzhou and other places, and is not outstanding in Jiangsu Province. The key issue is the debt ratio.

;

;Zhenjiang’s debt ratio is much higher than that of other cities in Jiangsu. According to the aforementioned calculation method, in 2013, its debt ratio was only 41.71%, and in 2020 it reached 121%. If the debt ratio is too high, it means that the local comprehensive financial resources are difficult to repay debts, and cannot even guarantee the existence of debts, which is prone to risks.

;

;Most of the urban investment debts in Guizhou, Yunnan and other places are concentrated at the county level. But in Zhenjiang, urban investment debts are mainly concentrated in municipal platforms. The enterprise warning notice shows that in 2022, the interest-bearing debt of Zhenjiang's top four municipal urban investment platforms will be 207.5 billion yuan, and the interest-bearing debt of all urban investment platforms in Zhenjiang will be 340.5 billion yuan, accounting for 61%.

;

;This situation is also related to Zhenjiang’s economic structure. Zhenjiang has jurisdiction over 3 districts and 3 county-level cities. The economic aggregate of county-level cities is higher than that of municipal districts.

;

;“In the past few years, Zhenjiang City has not been as prosperous as the counties (county-level cities) below. Mainstream financial institutions would rather do business in the counties (county-level cities) than invest in the cities. Platform operation." Wang Li, who works for a financial leasing company in Shanghai, and whose major customers are mainly urban investment companies across Jiangsu, explained to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In order to alleviate financing pressure, Zhenjiang Urban Investment Platform began to issue a large number of non-standard products. Compared with bank loans and bonds, non-standard financing issuance costs are higher.

;

;Zhenjiang Cultural Tourism Industry Group (hereinafter referred to as "Zhenjiang Cultural Tourism") is 100% owned by the Zhenjiang Municipal State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission and is a municipal urban investment platform. Zhenjiang Cultural Tourism's bond prospectus shows that in 2017, its non-standard financing scale was only 2.8 billion yuan, and by 2020, it had climbed to 11.8 billion yuan.

;

;In the past ten years, Zhang Huan has spent tens of millions of yuan purchasing non-standard products from urban investment companies in various places. He told Southern Weekend reporters that around 2016, he purchased non-standard products in Zhenjiang, and the interest rate was less than 7%. However, at that time, the income from urban investment bonds in Guizhou, Yunnan and other places was higher, and non-standard products in Zhenjiang were not easy to sell. " In order to persuade me to buy, the agent would give me some rebates, such as buying 1 million and getting 10,000 back."

;

;An employee of a financing intermediary company told Southern Weekend reporters that the highest coupon rate for non-standard products in Zhenjiang was around 9%. The employee said that at first Zhenjiang’s district and county urban investment platforms were issuing such products, probably because of the difficulty in financing, but later they were concentrated on municipal platforms with larger assets.

;

;Support from provincial governments

;

;Fortunately, the Jiangsu Provincial Government and the Zhenjiang Municipal Government began to solve the urban investment debt problem before the risk occurred.

;

;At the beginning of 2019, news leaked out of the market that the China Development Bank would replace Zhenjiang’s implicit debt at a cost of 20 billion yuan a year for 2 years.

;

;At the end of that year, Zheng Zhijie, the former president of the China Development Bank, said at a forum, "Zhenjiang has problems with high repayment pressure and high costs. Zhenjiang also wants to extend the term and reduce the current financial burden. I also We participated in the talks, but the Zhenjiang News plan was not approved by the Ministry of Finance."

;

;In March 2019, when talking about how to resolve the existing debt, Finance Minister Liu Kun stated that he would insist that the central government would not bail out. Who is responsible for borrowing money, so that "whose family's children will be cared for".

;

;After the CDB’s plan was not passed, Jiangsu Province began to increase its debt support for Zhenjiang. The specific methods were to increase the scale of special bonds, reduce the financing pressure of urban investment platforms, and avoid relying on high-interest non-standard loans. product.

;

;Special bonds of municipal and county governments are issued by provincial governments on their behalf. After counting the budget implementation status of various regions in Jiangsu, it can be found that the scale of special debt in Zhenjiang in 2019 increased by 34.6 billion yuan compared with the previous year. Among the 13 prefecture-level cities in Jiangsu, Zhenjiang is the place with the largest increase in the scale of special debt. In 2020, the scale of Zhenjiang's special bonds increased by 42.5 billion year-on-year, also exceeding other regions in the province.

;

;After the large-scale issuance of special bonds, the scale of Zhenjiang government debt has changed accordingly. According to data such as Zhenjiang City's budget implementation, Zhenjiang City's government debt scale was 109.7 billion yuan in 2019, which is not outstanding in the province. In 2021, the debt will rise to 191.8 billion yuan, second only to Nanjing.

;

;At the same time, Zhenjiang also replaced high-cost hidden debts by issuing replacement bonds.

;

;In the 2019 financial accounts of Danyang City and Dantu District under the jurisdiction of Zhenjiang, the replacement of hidden debts was mentioned. According to the final accounts report of Danyang City, the government bonds issued by Jiangsu Province in 2019 totaled 5.3 billion yuan, of which 1.4 billion yuan were replacement bonds, accounting for 26%. The replacement bonds were used to repay the existing implicit government debt of platform companies.

;

;Dantu District also revealed in its final accounting report that it issued 679 million yuan of existing replacement bonds to repay existing hidden debts.

;

;“In response to financial and debt risks, we have taken measures such as curbing growth, adjusting structure, and reducing costs. The total amount of government debt and costs have ‘double decreased’.” Zhenjiang Municipal Government’s 2021 Work Report wrote.

;

;According to Enterprise Early Warning Data, Zhenjiang’s urban investment interest-bearing debt increased by 200 million yuan year-on-year in 2021, with little change; in 2022, urban investment’s interest-bearing debt was 340.5 billion yuan, a year-on-year decrease of 9.7 billion Yuan. In other words, the debt scale of Zhenjiang’s urban investment platforms has been controlled and is trending down.

;

;Many urban investment practitioners in Jiangsu told Southern Weekend reporters that the most critical factor in Zhenjiang’s debt-oriented development is the financial and policy support from Jiangsu Province. For a long time, Jiangsu's GDP has ranked second in the country and has strong economic strength.

;

;The official website of the Lianyungang government shows that on May 27, 2022, the north-south paired assistance meeting between Wuxi and Lianyungang was officially held. For more than 20 years, Lianyungang has been supported by Zhenjiang. For Zhenjiang, withdrawing from assistance can alleviate some of the financial pressure. In addition, changing Lianyungang's sponsor from Zhenjiang to Wuxi also requires coordination from provincial government departments.

;

;In addition, Zhenjiang also has professional cadres handling debt matters.

;

;In 2020, Zhou Kai, then vice president of Bank of Jiangsu, was transferred to deputy mayor of Zhenjiang City. Previously, he worked at China Construction Bank Jiangsu Branch, Bank of Nanjing and Bank of Jiangsu for more than 20 years. According to the official website of the Zhenjiang Municipal Government, Zhou Kai is in charge of the local financial regulatory bureau, the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission, municipal state-owned enterprises, etc., and assists in being in charge of the Finance Bureau. The deputy mayor must also be nominated by the Organization Department of the Provincial Party Committee.

;

;Reduce financing costs

;

;In 2021, Jiangsu Province issued the "Guiding Opinions on Regulating the Investment and Financing Behavior of Financing Platform Companies", requiring guidance for financing platform companies to gradually reduce trust and capital costs. management plans, financial leasing, private equity funds and various non-standard products issued on local trading venues.

;

;In addition to replacing hidden debt with bonds, Zhenjiang also received assistance from banks to increase credit and reduce financing costs.

;

;Zhenjiang Communications Industry Group (;hereinafter referred to as "Zhenjiang Communications Investment";) wrote in the bond prospectus , with the coordination and support of government resources, since 2020, the total amount of corporate bank credit has increased, high-interest non-standard financing has been cleared to a greater extent, the debt composition and financing costs have been better improved, and financing costs have decreased by 0.84% ​​compared with 2019. .

;

;After analyzing bond prospectuses, Southern Weekend reporters found that between 2020 and 2023, the top four urban investment platforms in Zhenjiang in terms of asset size have all seen sharp declines in non-standard financing.

;

;Among them, the one with the largest scale reduction is Zhenjiang Communications Investment. In March 2020, the amount of non-standard financing in Zhenjiang was 15.3 billion yuan, accounting for 25.86% of the total financing scale; in March 2023, the amount of non-standard financing was 5.555 billion yuan, accounting for 10% of the total financing scale. Compared with three years ago, it dropped by 9.745 billion yuan.

;

;Zhang Lin works at a municipal urban investment platform in Zhenjiang. He told Southern Weekend reporters that the company had cleared away other high-cost non-standard products, except for short-term emergency financing, which could only be done after filing. According to the person from the above-mentioned financing intermediary company, there are currently no non-standard products for the public in Zhenjiang.

;

;Since 2023, many places in Jiangsu have announced the upper limit of financing interest rates for urban investment. Several people from Zhenjiang's urban investment platform told Southern Weekend reporters that the upper limit of Zhenjiang's external financing costs is 6.7%.

;

;Currently, this interest rate is at a medium level in Jiangsu Province. A staff member of an urban investment platform in Nanjing told Southern Weekend reporters that the local urban investment financing limit is 4.2% (five-year LPR), which is almost the strictest regulation in Jiangsu.

;

; According to people from the above-mentioned financing intermediary companies, some urban investment platforms in Jiangsu can issue fixed financing products with interest rates of up to 7%-8%. "Actually, the upper limit of issuance cost is 6.699%." Zhang Lin said that if the red line of 6.7% cannot be reached, "lower cost financing must be achieved."

;

;In July 2022, the Zhenjiang Municipal State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission issued a document stating that for high-cost financing projects that meet or exceed the financing cost control price determined by the municipal government, the "High-cost Debt Management Approval Form" must be filled out one by one in advance 》, after the enterprise implements the internal decision-making procedures, it can be carried out after being reviewed by the Municipal State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission, reported to the leaders of the municipal government for approval, and reported to the Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection and Supervision for filing.

;

;The above-mentioned Nanjing Urban Investment person also revealed that if the cost of a financing reaches 5%, the district will advise you not to do it. If there is real financial pressure, the district will coordinate.

;

;The Zhenjiang City State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission’s document also mentioned that it is necessary to clarify the mutual insurance quotas of enterprises based on the financing needs and affordability of relevant enterprises, implement total amount control, and prevent cross-conduction of debt risks and unlimited extension of debt chains. In principle No guarantee shall be provided in excess of the mutual insurance limit.

;

;In the past few years, the mutual guarantee situation among Zhenjiang municipal-level urban investment companies has not been optimistic, with Zhenjiang Cultural Tourism being the most serious.

;

; Its bond prospectus shows that as of the end of March 2020, the issuer’s external guarantee balance totaled 16.7 billion yuan, accounting for 97.93% of net assets. The company provides relatively large amounts of external guarantees, mainly to state-owned enterprises.

;

;“Recovering economic losses of nearly 1.6 billion yuan”

;

;On the basis of specifying the upper limit of financing costs, Zhenjiang and other places in Jiangsu are further reducing financing intermediary fees.

;

;In April 2019, the Zhenjiang Municipal Party Committee wrote in a report on the progress of inspections and rectifications that it is necessary to further standardize the decision-making and operating procedures of financing projects, strictly control intermediary agency service fees, formulate intermediary agency service management methods, and adopt intermediary Institutional access system.

;

;Incorporate the intermediate business expenses in the credit link into the total cost and determine them together, require all municipal industrial groups to register their accounts in detail, and eliminate the payment of financing and financial advisory fees to third-party non-financial institutions.

;

;“Some urban investment platforms are controlled by intermediaries, and there is no way around them.” Li Yu has worked in many financial leasing companies. He told Southern Weekend reporters that intermediaries generally have a close relationship with the leaders of urban investment companies. Internet, "Even if the cost is low, urban investment will not do business with you, you must go through an intermediary."

;

;Li Yu said that after the intermediary participates, it will push up the financing cost. For example, if 6% of the cost can be financed, the final cost will be 8%, and the middle 2% will be between the intermediary, urban investment, and investors. divided into.

;

;An article published on the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the National Supervisory Commission stated that since the launch of a special rectification of corruption issues in the financing field in January 2022, the Commission for Discipline Inspection and Supervision of Zhenjiang City, Jiangsu Province has filed a total of 22 cases and investigated party members and cadres, including those at the county level. With 3 cadres, nearly 1.6 billion yuan in economic losses were recovered.

;

;In the special rectification, the Zhenjiang Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection and Supervision comprehensively reviewed the financing business of platform companies at the municipal, county and township levels in the past ten years, focusing on and verifying financing projects whose comprehensive financing costs significantly exceeded the market interest rate. , sorting out financing projects with major doubts such as illegal payment of intermediary fees and abnormal comprehensive financing costs.

;

;At the same time, it was discovered that a number of fund "brokers" were involved in cross-regional financing business and obtained high intermediary fees, as well as bribing platform company officials. A total of 10 fund "brokers" were investigated and punished.

;

;Li Yu revealed that this year, government staff from a certain place in Jiangsu came to a financial leasing company where he previously worked and demanded the return of funds that were higher than the upper limit of financing costs.

;

;At present, urban investment platforms across Jiangsu are very sensitive to financing costs. In October, at a financing negotiation meeting of a certain urban investment company in Jiangsu, Southern Weekend reporters saw an executive repeatedly negotiating with bank staff, hoping that the other party could reduce the channel fee of 3‰.

;

;“Now when the person in charge of an urban investment company goes to the government for a meeting, the first thing he reports is not the current status of the company’s operations, but the situation of debt repayment.” A Zhenjiang urban investment practitioner said.

;

;In Wang Li’s view, Zhenjiang Urban Investment’s debt has not been significantly compressed, but the internal debt structure has been well adjusted, non-standard financing has accounted for a low proportion, and the debt can survive stably. “What financial institutions value most is Or debt stability.”

;

;Wang Li’s company has conducted statistics and found that the number of new financial leases in Jiangsu in 2022 dropped by 40% year-on-year.

;

;In the past few years, governments at all levels in Zhenjiang have also revitalized state-owned assets to relieve financial pressure. In 2018, Zhenjiang City's state-owned capital operating income was only 568 million yuan, and it reached 4.854 billion yuan in 2020, mainly coming from property rights transfer income at the municipal level.

;

;However, the number of high-quality state-owned assets is limited and this income is difficult to sustain. In 2022, state-owned capital operating income will drop to 585 million yuan.

;

;In the past few years, with the help of the provincial government and financial institutions, Zhenjiang has improved its debt structure by curbing the increase in debt and replacing high-interest debt. Coupled with the recovery of financing intermediary fees and the establishment of financing cost ceilings and other control measures, the debt ratio has been steadily reduced.

;

;In January 2023, the Zhenjiang Municipal Government’s work report revealed that in 2022, in response to financial debt risks, the government will strengthen the concept of “debt reduction is also political achievement” and further promote “redundancy reduction” and “peak reduction”. Four plans, annual goals and tasks were fully achieved.

;

;Beginning in 2019, the Ministry of Finance established a local government debt risk rating mechanism, dividing debt risks into red (debt rate ≥ 300%), orange (200% ≤ debt rate < 300%), yellow There are four levels: (120% ≤ debt ratio < 200%) and green (debt ratio < 120%). "Going off the red" refers to the debt risk level that leaves the red.
